message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we can first factor out the common factor in the numerator and then cancel out the common terms in the numerator and denominator.

(8x^3 + 12x^2 - 4x)/(4x^2)

Factor out the common factor 4x in the numerator:

4x(2x^2 + 3x - 1)/(4x^2)

Now, cancel out the common terms 4x in the numerator and denominator:

(2x^2 + 3x - 1)/(x)

So, the simplified rational expression is:

(2x^2 + 3x - 1)/(x)
